After  overtime loss to Hartwick Booters eager to face A10 foe

On paper it looks like the easiest game of the year for the mens soccer team PERIOD

Penn State will host Atlantic  doormat St PERIOD Bonaventure   in the A10 at  tonight at Jeffrey Field PERIOD The Lions  overall and  in the A10 look to bounce back from a  overtime loss at Hartwick on Saturday PERIOD

 Coach Barry Gorman said PERIOD 

For Penn State  in its last four matches tonights match presents a golden opportunity to get back on track before the crucial final two weeks of the season PERIOD

 sweeper Einar Dahle said PERIOD 

The Bonnies have struggled mightily this fall PERIOD St PERIOD Bonaventure has scored just nine goals  six of which came in a  victory over Niagara PERIOD In their  losses the Bonnies have been outscored  PERIOD

The Bonnies top scorer is senior midfielder Chris Boyle who has two goals and two assists PERIOD Senior Jim Kane who has a goalsagainst average of . will start in goal PERIOD

Freshman Marc Dinacci will remain Penn States starting goalkeeper PERIOD

Gorman said he will stick with Dinacci for now PERIOD In the last five games Dinacci has one shutout  saves and a . goalsagainst average PERIOD

 Gorman said PERIOD 

Keith Engelhardt and Mike Imm the other two goalkeepers are both healthy and could see action if the Lions get a big lead PERIOD Engelhardt has not played since he went down with a bruised thigh against Temple on Sept PERIOD  PERIOD Imm has not appeared in a game since Sept PERIOD  PERIOD

The Lions have received a strong effort off the bench recently from forward Steve Morell PERIOD Morell a senior from Canton Mich. scored his second career goal against Hartwick giving Penn State a shortlived lead in the second overtime PERIOD

 Gorman said PERIOD 

 Morell said PERIOD
